poem:
Title: "Canine Chasms in Love's Hallway"

Arfur, the spaniel, reigns our bed, 
our drifting slumbers his velvet stead, 
Lust drowned in biscuit-crumb coated dread.
Not by the tail, but heart he led.

Passion, once kindled neath satin spread,
now canine kisses, love's currency fled.
In the hall of our intimacy, a four-legged wedge,
Not man, nor woman, but dog holds the edge.
